channel.title: INtopBackup
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INtopBackup, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: The broke college student's guide to managing money
item.description: For college students who don't have a lot of money, it can be tough to wrap your head around student loans, credit cards and a tight budget. A financi...

item.title: Lab results confusing? Some patients use AI to interpret them, for better or worse
item.description: While patients wait to hear back from their doctors about test results, many turn to AI assistants for answers. There are issues with privacy and accu...

item.title: What we know about the shooting death of conservative activist Charlie Kirk
item.description: Kirk was killed Wednesday while speaking at a campus event in Utah. There is no suspect in custody.

item.title: After 10 years of black hole science, Stephen Hawking proven right
item.description: Researchers have spent ten years improving the massive detectors they use to catch shockwaves from colliding black holes, and now the science is preci...

item.title: Israel has hunted its top enemies around the Middle East. What has it achieved?
item.description: Israel's surprise attack in Qatar on Tuesday targeting Hamas' top political leaders was the latest in a campaign aimed at hunting down Israel's top en...

item.title: Killing of Trump ally lays bare America's bloody and broken politics
item.description: Charlie Kirk's killing is another episode of gun violence in America and the latest in a line of recent political violence.

item.title: 9/10: CBS Evening News
item.description: Everything we know about the fatal shooting of Charlie Kirk; Rocks found on Mars may hold potential signs of ancient life

item.title: Preserving the story of 9/11 | 60 Minutes Archive
item.description: Lesley Stahl visited the 9/11 Museum in 2013, a year before it opened, and explored its most challenging debates and agonizing decisions.

item.title: Shooter still at large after conservative activist Charlie Kirk assassinated at Utah university
South African court rules that men can take wife's surname
item.description: The highest court rules that a law barring men from taking the surnames of their wives is discriminatory.

item.title: More than 300 Koreans detained by ICE in Georgia are heading home
item.description: The ICE raid that swept up 300 South Koreans in Georgia has strained an important bilateral relationship, and highlighted a significant challenge.

item.title: British ambassador to U.S. fired over his ties to Jeffrey Epstein

item.title: 'Everyone hit the deck and scattered': Witnesses describe moment of Utah shooting
item.description: Witnesses describe screaming and running to flee the scene after hearing the fatal gunshot that killed Kirk.

item.title: Ghana agrees to accept West Africans deported from US
item.description: Fourteen deportees including nationals of Nigeria and The Gambia have already arrived, President Mahama says.

item.title: Charlie Kirk shot and killed at Utah event; manhunt for shooter ongoing
item.description: Conservative activist and Turning Point USA co-founder Charlie Kirk died Wednesday after he was shot at an event at Utah Valley University.

item.title: Assassination of Charlie Kirk adds to America’s roll call of public violence
item.description: In the tragic roll call of violence in American public life, Charlie Kirk’s name joins the long list.

item.title: Bali's worst floods in a decade kill 14
item.description: Authorities say the flash floods on the popular island were caused by heavy rainfall.

item.title: South Korea says detained Korean workers released from Georgia facility before flight home
